alert.note: Alert for San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 11:40AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... San Juan River At Farmington affecting San Juan County. .Snowmelt in the San Juan Mountains is driving up flows in the Animas River. These flows are combining with increased flows on the San Juan River from the controlled release of water out of Navajo Dam. Water will be flowing quickly and may overtop the banks in low lying areas. Exercise caution near the banks of the river as they may be unstable. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows in the river are expected, with possible overbank flow in low lying areas. * WHERE...San Juan River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Overbank flow is occurring from just below the confluence of the Animas and San Juan Rivers at Farmington, and continuing downriver through Shiprock. At this water level, the fast flow can result in river bank erosion but otherwise minor flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 7.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 6.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 7.2 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall to 6.8 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 6.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon around 100 PM MDT.
